meanings.definition: Suckier (comparative of suck): More unpleasant or disappointing.
meanings.sent1: The weather today is suckier than yesterday.
meanings.sent2: This movie is even suckier than the last one.
meanings.sent3: I thought Mondays couldn't get any suckier, but then my alarm didn't go off.
meanings.sent4: Her attitude towards the project made the atmosphere even suckier.
meanings.sent5: The taste of the medicine was so suckier that I couldn't swallow it.

meanings.definition: Suckier (adjective): Of worse quality or more unpleasant.
meanings.sent1: The old car was suckier than the new one.
meanings.sent2: The food at that restaurant is always suckier than I expect.
meanings.sent3: His attempt at singing was even suckier than his dancing.
meanings.sent4: The situation grew suckier with each passing minute.
meanings.sent5: The smell in the room became suckier as the day went on.

meanings.definition: Suckier (adverb): In a more unpleasant or disappointing manner.
meanings.sent1: She performed suckier in the second round of the competition.
meanings.sent2: The team played even suckier in the final game of the season.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed suckier than usual when it wanted attention.
meanings.sent4: The music played suckier as the storm approached.
meanings.sent5: The mood in the room turned suckier as the argument escalated.
